channel.title: [PI] Item time limit. *I guess this is solved; Just moving on*
channel.description: Hey guys, how would I make a item have a time limit to it, before it disappears? Is it even possible? EDIT: Like the item does NOT have to be in action for it to run(Like the degrading system) the time limit starts right when you wield it.

item.title: [PI] Item time limit. *I guess this is solved; Just moving on*
item.dc:creator: @Virgin Virgin
item.description:
@Virgin wrote:

Lolololol? I cannot do that, it’s everywhere. Just come look if you care so much.
Right now i’m trying to figure out how to make a scroll open up a text interface… I cannot seem to figure that out -.- as simple as it sounds.

Read full topic

That’s not an issue with your timer, that’s an issue with the rest of your code.

item.dc:creator: @wildskiller wildskiller
item.description:
@wildskiller wrote:

tyb97:

Even with that, what if about 30 players are initializing timers, wouldn’t that create a lot of load on the server?

Well, what else can you do besides use game ticks, which isn’t the correct time. I’ve calculated 0.60 seconds = 1 tick

Since that will happen, I’ll just remove it.

item.dc:creator: @tyb97 tyb97
item.description:
@tyb97 wrote:

Wouldn’t timers be bad for servers though? As I’ve been told before, it’s not good to have a new thread each time the player triggers the time dependent action… (Which I was probably lied to of course).

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] Item time limit. *I guess this is solved; Just moving on*
item.dc:creator: @wildskiller wildskiller
item.description:
@wildskiller wrote:

[quote=“AtomicInt_, post:14, topic:459789”]That is not necessary at all, Wild. It is not used correctly.

there are things in the Java utilities that allow you to do something like this if you’re not using an event system (which you should as almost every server has one implemented)

java.util.Timer & java.util.TimerTask check it out[/quote]

I use java.util.Timer
I really don’t need ActionListener. Tbh, idk why I am using it.

I use this for the player’s time online

private final TimeHandler timeHandler = new TimeHandler(this); private final Timer timer = new Timer(1000, timeHandler);

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @ExtremeX-Scape Ryley
item.description:
@ExtremeX-Scape wrote:

That is not necessary at all, Wild. It is not used correctly.

there are things in the Java utilities that allow you to do something like this if you’re not using an event system (which you should as almost every server has one implemented)

java.util.Timer & java.util.TimerTask check it out

item.title: [PI] Item time limit. *I guess this is solved; Just moving on*
item.dc:creator: @wildskiller wildskiller
item.description:
@wildskiller wrote:

[quote=“tyb97, post:12, topic:459789”]Lets take a look at the facts from Oracle,

http://java.sun.com/products/jfc/tsc/articles/threads/threads1.html:

The single-thread rule: Swing components can be accessed by only one thread at a time. Generally, this thread is the event-dispatching thread.

Since PI is a single-threaded application, this just doesn’t look right. Swing components shouldn’t be implemented into a server, its just stupid, they are designed for GUI’s. I don’t know all the terminology used with threads, so I’m having trouble explaining this.

EDIT: I’ll call the savior. Sec.[/quote]

Nothing will mess up if I don’t call any methods from another class in TimeHandler

Read full topic

The single-thread rule: Swing components can be accessed by only one thread at a time. Generally, this thread is the event-dispatching thread.

Since PI is a single-threaded application, this just doesn’t look right. Swing components shouldn’t be implemented into a server, its just stupid, they are designed for GUI’s. I don’t know all the terminology used with threads, so I’m having trouble explaining this.

EDIT: I’ll call the savior. Sec.

item.title: [PI] Item time limit. *I guess this is solved; Just moving on*
item.dc:creator: @wildskiller wildskiller
item.description:
@wildskiller wrote:

[quote=“tyb97, post:7, topic:459789”][quote author=wildskiller link=topic=562692.msg4102453#msg4102453 date=1347660918]

You could always just use an event/cycleevent system and make a simple process system: (Ripped from my Woodcutting snippet)

        public static void cutWood(final Client c, final int objId) {
                final Tree tree = getTree(objId);
                checkAxe(c);
                if (c.playerLevel[SkillConstants.WOODCUTTING] >= tree.getRequiredLevel()) {
                        if (c.currentAxe != null) {
                                if (c.playerLevel[SkillConstants.WOODCUTTING] >= c.currentAxe
                                                .getRequiredLevel()) {
                                        if (c.getItems().freeSlots() != 0) {
                                        c.sendMessage("You begin to cut the tree.");
                                        c.turnPlayerTo(c.objectX, c.objectY);
                                        c.startAnimation(c.currentAxe.getAnimation());
                                        CycleEventHandler.getSingleton().addEvent(c,
                                                        new CycleEvent() {
                                                                int timer = getTick(tree);

                                                                @Override
                                                                public void execute(
                                                                                CycleEventContainer container) {

                                                                        if (timer == 0 && timer != -1) {
                                                                                container.stop();
                                                                        }
                                                                       
                                                                        if (c.getItems().freeSlots() == 0) {
                                                                                container.stop();
                                                                        }

                                                                        if (timer > 0 && c != null) {
                                                                                timer--;
                                                                                c.getItems()
                                                                                                .addItem(tree.getLogId(), 1);
                                                                                c.getPA().addSkillXP(
                                                                                                tree.getExperience()
                                                                                                                * Config.XP_RATE,
                                                                                                SkillConstants.WOODCUTTING);
                                                                        }
                                                                }

                                                                @Override
                                                                public void stop() {
                                                                        c.startAnimation(65535);
                                                                        c.currentAxe = null;
                                                                        createStump(c, c.objectX, c.objectY, objId,
                                                                                        5);
                                                                }

                                                        }, 1);
                                        } else {
                                                c.sendMessage("You have no room in your inventory!");
                                        }
                                } else {
                                        c.sendMessage("You need a woodcutting level of "
                                                        + c.currentAxe.getRequiredLevel()
                                                        + " to cut with this axe!");
                                }
                        } else {
                                c.sendMessage("You need an axe to cut this tree!");
                        }
                } else {
                        c.sendMessage("You need a woodcutting level of "
                                        + tree.getRequiredLevel() + " to cut this tree!");
                }
        }

        public static void createStump(final Client c, final int x, final int y,
                        final int objId, final int timer) {
                CycleEventHandler.getSingleton().addEvent(c, new CycleEvent() {
                        Object stump = new Object(objId, x, y, 0, -1, 10, 1343, 0);
                        int ticks = timer;

                        @Override
                        public void execute(CycleEventContainer container) {
                                if (ticks == 0 && ticks != -1) {
                                        container.stop();
                                }

                                if (ticks > 0 && c != null) {
                                        ticks--;
                                }
                        }

                        @Override
                        public void stop() {
                                new Object(1343, x, y, 0, 0, 10, objId, 0);
                        }

                }, 1);
        }
}

I use this for my degrading. It really is a bad way of doing it but it works.

[code=java]import javax.swing.;
import java.awt.;
import java.awt.event.*;

public class TimeHandler implements ActionListener {

private int day, hour, minute, second;

public void actionPerformed(ActionEvent event) {
	if (second == 60) {
		this.second = 0;
		this.minute += 1;
	}
	if (minute == 60) {
		this.minute = 0;
		this.hour += 1;
	}
	if (hour == 24) {
		this.hour = 0;
		this.day += 1;
	}
	this.second++;
}

public int getSeconds() {
	return second;
}

public int getMinutes() {
	return minute;
}

public int getHours() {
	return hour;
}

public int getDays() {
	return day;
}

}[/code]
[/quote]
Why in the hell are you using swing components in a private server? The ActionListener can’t be thread safe. Swing was made for use in GUI’s, and ONLY GUI’s.[/quote]

I know, but I don’t really care. I know what Swing is used for, I read. It doesn’t seem to mess up anything with my server so I’ll use it.

It doesn’t seem to mess with my player saving so I’m fine with it.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @tyb97 tyb97
item.description:
@tyb97 wrote:

[quote=“wildskiller, post:6, topic:459789”][quote author=tyb97 link=topic=562692.msg4102451#msg4102451 date=1347660768]
You could always just use an event/cycleevent system and make a simple process system: (Ripped from my Woodcutting snippet)

        public static void cutWood(final Client c, final int objId) {
                final Tree tree = getTree(objId);
                checkAxe(c);
                if (c.playerLevel[SkillConstants.WOODCUTTING] >= tree.getRequiredLevel()) {
                        if (c.currentAxe != null) {
                                if (c.playerLevel[SkillConstants.WOODCUTTING] >= c.currentAxe
                                                .getRequiredLevel()) {
                                        if (c.getItems().freeSlots() != 0) {
                                        c.sendMessage("You begin to cut the tree.");
                                        c.turnPlayerTo(c.objectX, c.objectY);
                                        c.startAnimation(c.currentAxe.getAnimation());
                                        CycleEventHandler.getSingleton().addEvent(c,
                                                        new CycleEvent() {
                                                                int timer = getTick(tree);

                                                                @Override
                                                                public void execute(
                                                                                CycleEventContainer container) {

                                                                        if (timer == 0 && timer != -1) {
                                                                                container.stop();
                                                                        }
                                                                       
                                                                        if (c.getItems().freeSlots() == 0) {
                                                                                container.stop();
                                                                        }

                                                                        if (timer > 0 && c != null) {
                                                                                timer--;
                                                                                c.getItems()
                                                                                                .addItem(tree.getLogId(), 1);
                                                                                c.getPA().addSkillXP(
                                                                                                tree.getExperience()
                                                                                                                * Config.XP_RATE,
                                                                                                SkillConstants.WOODCUTTING);
                                                                        }
                                                                }

                                                                @Override
                                                                public void stop() {
                                                                        c.startAnimation(65535);
                                                                        c.currentAxe = null;
                                                                        createStump(c, c.objectX, c.objectY, objId,
                                                                                        5);
                                                                }

                                                        }, 1);
                                        } else {
                                                c.sendMessage("You have no room in your inventory!");
                                        }
                                } else {
                                        c.sendMessage("You need a woodcutting level of "
                                                        + c.currentAxe.getRequiredLevel()
                                                        + " to cut with this axe!");
                                }
                        } else {
                                c.sendMessage("You need an axe to cut this tree!");
                        }
                } else {
                        c.sendMessage("You need a woodcutting level of "
                                        + tree.getRequiredLevel() + " to cut this tree!");
                }
        }

        public static void createStump(final Client c, final int x, final int y,
                        final int objId, final int timer) {
                CycleEventHandler.getSingleton().addEvent(c, new CycleEvent() {
                        Object stump = new Object(objId, x, y, 0, -1, 10, 1343, 0);
                        int ticks = timer;

                        @Override
                        public void execute(CycleEventContainer container) {
                                if (ticks == 0 && ticks != -1) {
                                        container.stop();
                                }

                                if (ticks > 0 && c != null) {
                                        ticks--;
                                }
                        }

                        @Override
                        public void stop() {
                                new Object(1343, x, y, 0, 0, 10, objId, 0);
                        }

                }, 1);
        }
}

[/quote]

I use this for my degrading. It really is a bad way of doing it but it works.

[code=java]import javax.swing.;
import java.awt.;
import java.awt.event.*;

public class TimeHandler implements ActionListener {

private int day, hour, minute, second;

public void actionPerformed(ActionEvent event) {
	if (second == 60) {
		this.second = 0;
		this.minute += 1;
	}
	if (minute == 60) {
		this.minute = 0;
		this.hour += 1;
	}
	if (hour == 24) {
		this.hour = 0;
		this.day += 1;
	}
	this.second++;
}

public int getSeconds() {
	return second;
}

public int getMinutes() {
	return minute;
}

public int getHours() {
	return hour;
}

public int getDays() {
	return day;
}

}[/code][/quote]
Why in the hell are you using swing components in a private server? The ActionListener can’t be thread safe. Swing was made for use in GUI’s, and ONLY GUI’s.

item.dc:creator: @wildskiller wildskiller
item.description:
@wildskiller wrote:

[quote=“tyb97, post:5, topic:459789”]You could always just use an event/cycleevent system and make a simple process system: (Ripped from my Woodcutting snippet)

[code=Java]
public static void cutWood(final Client c, final int objId) {
final Tree tree = getTree(objId);
checkAxe©;
if (c.playerLevel[SkillConstants.WOODCUTTING] >= tree.getRequiredLevel()) {
if (c.currentAxe != null) {
if (c.playerLevel[SkillConstants.WOODCUTTING] >= c.currentAxe
.getRequiredLevel()) {
if (c.getItems().freeSlots() != 0) {
c.sendMessage(“You begin to cut the tree.”);
c.turnPlayerTo(c.objectX, c.objectY);
c.startAnimation(c.currentAxe.getAnimation());
CycleEventHandler.getSingleton().addEvent(c,
new CycleEvent() {
int timer = getTick(tree);

                                                            @Override
                                                            public void execute(
                                                                            CycleEventContainer container) {

                                                                    if (timer == 0 && timer != -1) {
                                                                            container.stop();
                                                                    }
                                                                   
                                                                    if (c.getItems().freeSlots() == 0) {
                                                                            container.stop();
                                                                    }

                                                                    if (timer > 0 && c != null) {
                                                                            timer--;
                                                                            c.getItems()
                                                                                            .addItem(tree.getLogId(), 1);
                                                                            c.getPA().addSkillXP(
                                                                                            tree.getExperience()
                                                                                                            * Config.XP_RATE,
                                                                                            SkillConstants.WOODCUTTING);
                                                                    }
                                                            }

                                                            @Override
                                                            public void stop() {
                                                                    c.startAnimation(65535);
                                                                    c.currentAxe = null;
                                                                    createStump(c, c.objectX, c.objectY, objId,
                                                                                    5);
                                                            }

                                                    }, 1);
                                    } else {
                                            c.sendMessage("You have no room in your inventory!");
                                    }
                            } else {
                                    c.sendMessage("You need a woodcutting level of "
                                                    + c.currentAxe.getRequiredLevel()
                                                    + " to cut with this axe!");
                            }
                    } else {
                            c.sendMessage("You need an axe to cut this tree!");
                    }
            } else {
                    c.sendMessage("You need a woodcutting level of "
                                    + tree.getRequiredLevel() + " to cut this tree!");
            }
    }

    public static void createStump(final Client c, final int x, final int y,
                    final int objId, final int timer) {
            CycleEventHandler.getSingleton().addEvent(c, new CycleEvent() {
                    Object stump = new Object(objId, x, y, 0, -1, 10, 1343, 0);
                    int ticks = timer;

                    @Override
                    public void execute(CycleEventContainer container) {
                            if (ticks == 0 && ticks != -1) {
                                    container.stop();
                            }

                            if (ticks > 0 && c != null) {
                                    ticks--;
                            }
                    }

                    @Override
                    public void stop() {
                            new Object(1343, x, y, 0, 0, 10, objId, 0);
                    }

            }, 1);
    }

}
[/code][/quote]

I use this for my degrading. It really is a bad way of doing it but it works.

[code=java]import javax.swing.;
import java.awt.;
import java.awt.event.*;

public class TimeHandler implements ActionListener {

private int day, hour, minute, second;

public void actionPerformed(ActionEvent event) {
	if (second == 60) {
		this.second = 0;
		this.minute += 1;
	}
	if (minute == 60) {
		this.minute = 0;
		this.hour += 1;
	}
	if (hour == 24) {
		this.hour = 0;
		this.day += 1;
	}
	this.second++;
}

public int getSeconds() {
	return second;
}

public int getMinutes() {
	return minute;
}

public int getHours() {
	return hour;
}

public int getDays() {
	return day;
}

}[/code]

item.description:
@tyb97 wrote:

You could always just use an event/cycleevent system and make a simple process system: (Ripped from my Woodcutting snippet)

        public static void cutWood(final Client c, final int objId) {
                final Tree tree = getTree(objId);
                checkAxe(c);
                if (c.playerLevel[SkillConstants.WOODCUTTING] >= tree.getRequiredLevel()) {
                        if (c.currentAxe != null) {
                                if (c.playerLevel[SkillConstants.WOODCUTTING] >= c.currentAxe
                                                .getRequiredLevel()) {
                                        if (c.getItems().freeSlots() != 0) {
                                        c.sendMessage("You begin to cut the tree.");
                                        c.turnPlayerTo(c.objectX, c.objectY);
                                        c.startAnimation(c.currentAxe.getAnimation());
                                        CycleEventHandler.getSingleton().addEvent(c,
                                                        new CycleEvent() {
                                                                int timer = getTick(tree);

                                                                @Override
                                                                public void execute(
                                                                                CycleEventContainer container) {

                                                                        if (timer == 0 && timer != -1) {
                                                                                container.stop();
                                                                        }
                                                                       
                                                                        if (c.getItems().freeSlots() == 0) {
                                                                                container.stop();
                                                                        }

                                                                        if (timer > 0 && c != null) {
                                                                                timer--;
                                                                                c.getItems()
                                                                                                .addItem(tree.getLogId(), 1);
                                                                                c.getPA().addSkillXP(
                                                                                                tree.getExperience()
                                                                                                                * Config.XP_RATE,
                                                                                                SkillConstants.WOODCUTTING);
                                                                        }
                                                                }

                                                                @Override
                                                                public void stop() {
                                                                        c.startAnimation(65535);
                                                                        c.currentAxe = null;
                                                                        createStump(c, c.objectX, c.objectY, objId,
                                                                                        5);
                                                                }

                                                        }, 1);
                                        } else {
                                                c.sendMessage("You have no room in your inventory!");
                                        }
                                } else {
                                        c.sendMessage("You need a woodcutting level of "
                                                        + c.currentAxe.getRequiredLevel()
                                                        + " to cut with this axe!");
                                }
                        } else {
                                c.sendMessage("You need an axe to cut this tree!");
                        }
                } else {
                        c.sendMessage("You need a woodcutting level of "
                                        + tree.getRequiredLevel() + " to cut this tree!");
                }
        }

        public static void createStump(final Client c, final int x, final int y,
                        final int objId, final int timer) {
                CycleEventHandler.getSingleton().addEvent(c, new CycleEvent() {
                        Object stump = new Object(objId, x, y, 0, -1, 10, 1343, 0);
                        int ticks = timer;

                        @Override
                        public void execute(CycleEventContainer container) {
                                if (ticks == 0 && ticks != -1) {
                                        container.stop();
                                }

                                if (ticks > 0 && c != null) {
                                        ticks--;
                                }
                        }

                        @Override
                        public void stop() {
                                new Object(1343, x, y, 0, 0, 10, objId, 0);
                        }

                }, 1);
        }
}

Read full topic
